content.title: Aame's Riddle
content.description:
The path is blocked by an old tortoise (Aame) sitting dead center. They wait. Aame doesn't move. Gunda tries to go around — Aame slowly swivels to face him again.

Aame speaks in a slow Kannada riddle. Gunda listens hard, uses question words to answer correctly. Aame considers for a long moment... then shuffles to the side. As Gunda passes, Aame says one more thing. Gunda: "What did that mean?" Gubbi shrugs.

content.question: The wise tortoise waits for Gunda! Did you ever get a small scolding from your father in childhood?
The boy found a small crab outside his home! What do we call a crab in Kannada?
The crab climbed on top of the roof! What did the boy use to climb up?
The father shouted, 'ಏಟು ಬೇಕಾ?' What does 'ಏಟು' mean in Kannada?

screens.content: Excellent! You learned 3 new Kannada words — ಏಡಿ (crab), ಏಣಿ (ladder), ಏಟು (beating)! Gubbi took three wobbly steps!
